result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Gordon Schalow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
0 days credit by stipulation of the parties at the time of sentencing.

Defendant to be eligible for Earned Release or any Substance Abuse Treatment programming.

Conditions: Cooperate with assessment, educational programming, counseling, or any other treatment at the discretion of the supervising agent. Pay all court costs and DOC supervision fees (court costs may have been paid from the Defendant's bond - DOC to refer to the Assessment Report for a costs breakdown). Submit DNA sample. Submit to evidentiary testing at the request of law enforcement or agent to monitor compliance. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Same as those stated for extended supervision. Court costs paid from bond. Def to pay costs of supervision.

AMENDED PSI
(corrections made in court at request of Atty McD)

Defendant Scott Gordon Schalow in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper has received a copy of the PSI and has no comments or modifications. Atty McD states she has modifications for the PSI. Atty McD requests modifications. Court corrects appropriate modifications. Amended PSI on file. 

No evidence from the State. Atty McD states she has one witness, DR. Witness DR addresses the court. Atty McD asks for letter from CB to be admitted. Court states its already been admitted. Atty Harper addresses the court and asks for court to adopt joint recommendation: 18 months of initial confinement in the Wisconsin State Prison system, 2 year extended supervision, imposed and stayed. 0 days credit. Atty McD addresses the court and asks for the court to adopt joint recommendation. Def addresses the court.

Court orders: 18 months of initial confinement in the Wisconsin State Prison system, 2 year extended supervision, imposed and stayed. 3 years of Probation. Eligible for Earned Release and any substance abuse treatment programs.  0 days credit by stipulation.
Conditions of ES: Must cooperate with assessment and educational programs, counseling or any other treatment at discretion of supervising agent, pay all court costs and DOC supervision fees, must submit DNA sample, submit to evidentiary testing by the compliance of law enforcement,and maintain absolute sobriety.

Sentencing hearing on February 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.

9:15 a.m.  Matter was set for sentencing this date, however, due to Court official emergency, matter is being reset and called today, off-the-record, for rescheduling of the 1-hour sentencing.  JA sets Friday, 2/3 at 11.
Sentencing Memorandum (forwarded to the Court this date for review prior to 11/4 sentencing)
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

AMENDED - The defendant shall reside at the home of Gordon and Marlene Schalow at 809 Park Avenue; Wausau, WI  54403.  The defendant shall be at the residence (includes the yard) at all times except for attending treatment/therapy sessions at North Central Health Care, except for daily PBT testing,  and except for verifiable medical appointments or emergencies, religious services, and court appearances.  Additionally, the defendant must present himself to the Richland County Jail or the clerk of court to sign his amended bail bond.

The defendant shall submit to a daily PBT at ATTIC Correctional Services in Wausau every day between the hours of 8 a.m. and 10 a.m. 

The defendant shall not possess or consume any amount of alcohol.  The defendant shall submit to a test of his breath, blood, or urine upon request of a law enforcement officer.  The defendant shall not enter into any bars or taverns or any establishment that derives its main source of revenue from the sale of alcohol.

The defendant shall not have any contact with Tammy Hoffman.

Defendant Scott Gordon Schalow in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA Harper states the parties have a resolution whereby def will be waiving right to prelim; State to file information with same charges as original complaint; def to plead GNC to count 2/failure to comply with officer's attempt to take person into custody; count 1 to be dismissed/read-in; counsel asking for PSI, free to argue on Count 2. Atty. M notes parties' joint request for lower bail. Court will take up that request at later time; notes time constraints of today's calendar. Proceeding with prelim waiver, Court conducts the colloquy. Prelim rights waived. Bindover ordered. Information filed. Formal reading waived. Plea questionnaire review/colloquy. Def pleads guilty to Count 2. Colloquy. Finding of guilty. 

PSI ordered. Def in Richland County Jail. 

Count 1 dismissed and read in.

PSI due 8/12 with author here or available by phone.

Re bond:  DA - parties jointly request $2500 cash bond with numerous conditions:  No contact with TH, no possess/consumption alcohol; no bars/taverns; submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand; no possession firearms; reside at the home of Kurt Pinkstaff 29434 Provold Drive in Richland Center; must be present at that residence at all times except from 3 p.m. to 9 p.m.; must day-report to RC Jail between 3-9 p.m. to submit PBT.
